com.hazelcast.internal.networking.nio

Class NioChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.networking.AbstractChannel
      • com.hazelcast.internal.networking.nio.NioChannel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Channel, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class NioChannel
extends AbstractChannel
    A Channel implementation tailored for non blocking IO using Selector in combination with a non blocking SocketChannel.

      • options

        public com.hazelcast.internal.networking.nio.NioChannelOptions options()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Returns the ChannelOptions of this Channel. Call is threadsafe; but calls to the ChannelOptions are not.
        Returns:
        the config for this channel. Returned value will never be null.

      • init

        public void init(NioInboundPipeline inboundPipeline,
                 NioOutboundPipeline outboundPipeline)

      • outboundPipeline

        public NioOutboundPipeline outboundPipeline()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Returns the OutboundPipeline that belongs to this Channel. This method is threadsafe, but most methods on the OutboundPipeline are not!
        Returns:
        the OutboundPipeline.

      • inboundPipeline

        public NioInboundPipeline inboundPipeline()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Returns the InboundPipeline that belongs to this Channel. This method is threadsafe, but most methods on the InboundPipeline are not!
        Returns:
        the InboundPipeline.

      • write

        public boolean write(OutboundFrame frame)
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Queues the OutboundFrame to be written at some point in the future. No guarantee is made that the frame actually is going to be written or received. This method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        frame - the frame to write.
        Returns:
        true if the frame was queued; false if rejected.

      • onConnect

        protected void onConnect()
        Description copied from class: AbstractChannel
        Template method that can be implemented when the AbstractChannel.connect(InetSocketAddress, int) has completed.
        Overrides:
        onConnect in class AbstractChannel

      • lastReadTimeMillis

        public long lastReadTimeMillis()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Returns the last time epoch time in ms a read of the socket was done. This method is thread-safe.
        Returns:
        the last time a read from the socket was done.

      • lastWriteTimeMillis

        public long lastWriteTimeMillis()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Returns the last time epoch time in ms a write to the socket was done. Writing to the socket doesn't mean that data has been send or received; it means that data was written to the SocketChannel. It could very well be that this data is stuck somewhere in an network-buffer. This method is thread-safe.
        Returns:
        the last time something was written to the socket.

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Channel
        Starts the Channel. In case of a client-mode channel, the Channel.connect(InetSocketAddress, int) should be called before start is called. When the Channel is started, the ChannelInitializer will be called to initialize the channel and to start with processing inbound and outbound data. This method is not threadsafe and should be made only once.

      • close0

        protected void close0()
        Description copied from class: AbstractChannel
        Template method that is called when the socket channel closed. It is called before the socketChannel is closed. It will be called only once.
        Overrides:
        close0 in class AbstractChannel

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
